item.title: Stop Trying to Solve Big Problems. Solve Boring Ones Beautifully.
item.description: You don’t need to invent the next Google. You need to make one annoying task a joy to complete. Here’s why small, overlooked problems are where the real gold lives.

item.title: The One-Page App Philosophy: Why Most SaaS Ideas Don’t Need a Dashboard
item.description: Most SaaS ideas don’t need sidebars, navbars, or account settings. They need to deliver one clear result, fast. Here’s why the one-page philosophy wins for indie tools.

item.title: Why I Ship Ugly First (and Why You Probably Should Too)
item.description: Shipping ugly isn’t lazy — it’s strategic. Here’s why launching imperfect products fast beats pixel-perfect delays, especially when you’re building microtools.

item.title: Stack First, Market Later: How to Cheat Your Way to Traffic
item.description: You don’t need a content strategy. You need a stack advantage. Here’s how to leverage your tech stack, app structure, and product decisions to generate traffic — before you touch marketing.

item.title: What I Learned Launching 5 Microtools in 10 Days
item.description: Lessons from a speedrun through five micro-SaaS launches. Chaos, clarity, and a few tools that stuck.
